summary: This document is an email chain from December 2018 between SDNY prosecutors discussing a 2016 meeting with attorney Peter Skinner regarding Jeffrey Epstein. It includes forwarded emails from Skinner providing case documents and a news article about Epstein's continued relationships with young women.

persons.name: Kurland, Abigail
persons.context: Addressed in email chain regarding obtaining notes and records from a meeting with Peter Skinner about the Epstein case.

persons.name: Kramer, Amanda
persons.context: Email sender who is asked to provide notes/records from her meeting with Peter Skinner and any follow-up meetings related to Epstein.

persons.name: Peter Skinner
persons.context: Attorney who met with SDNY prosecutors in 2016, provided case documents, and forwarded a news article about Epstein's relationships with young women.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Described as one of the lead attorneys on the case, added to the email chain by Peter Skinner for follow-up.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the case discussions; referenced in relation to a news article about his continued relationships with young women.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to a defamation case against her, where a motion to dismiss was denied.

persons.name: Stan Pottinger
persons.context: Listed as a recipient on an email from Peter Skinner forwarding case documents.

persons.name: Brad
persons.context: Listed as a recipient on an email from Peter Skinner forwarding case documents (likely Brad Edwards, but only 'Brad' is specified).

connections.description: Skinner adds McCawley to the email chain as a lead attorney on the case who knows the facts well.
Skinner met with Kramer (SDNY prosecutor) and provided her with case documents and information.
McCawley is described as a lead attorney on the case involving Jeffrey Epstein.
Maxwell is referenced in a defamation case within the context of the Epstein investigation.

events.title: PageSix Article on Epstein
events.description: The PageSix website reported on Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women, specifically mentioning his East Side mansion housing 'Russian playmates'.

events.title: Meeting with SDNY Prosecutors
events.description: Peter Skinner met with SDNY prosecutors (including Amanda Kramer) and subsequently provided them with case documents, including a complaint against Ghislaine Maxwell and declarations in the CVRA case.

events.title: Judge Sweet Denies Maxwell's Motion
events.description: Judge Sweet denied Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to dismiss in a defamation case on the same day the complaint was provided to prosecutors.

events.title: SDNY Follow-up on 2016 Meeting
events.description: SDNY prosecutors (Amanda Kramer, Abigail Kurland) correspond to obtain notes and records from the 2016 meeting with Peter Skinner as they try to 'get a complete handle on the landscape' of the Epstein case.

keyFacts: In March 2016, media reported on Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women, specifically at his East Side mansion.
Attorney Peter Skinner provided SDNY prosecutors with key case documents in February 2016, including a complaint against Ghislaine Maxwell and declarations in the CVRA case.
Judge Sweet denied Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to dismiss in a defamation case on February 29, 2016.
In December 2018, SDNY prosecutors were actively seeking notes and records from their 2016 meeting with Peter Skinner to better understand the Epstein case landscape.
Sigrid McCawley is identified as a lead attorney on the Epstein case with knowledge of the facts.
